instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - USB port not working.
threads.message:
usb2.0 and usb3.0 not working.
tried flash drives mouse.

5v present on L4605.
5v present on usb port's power pin.

<CHIP>U4650</CHIP>
pin 10 - 3.4v


Diode mode on pin 5,6 of J4600
0.641
0.641

Diode mode on <SIGNAL>USB_EXTA_P</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>USB_EXTA_N</SIGNAL>
0.404
0.404


i've replaced <CHIP>U4650</CHIP>, its still the same.

USB port looks clean under microscope.
I/O board's usb port is working fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - USB port not working.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U4650</CHIP> can be removed, bypassing D-Y data lines.

Check L4600 and <CAPACITOR>C4620</CAPACITOR>/21 integrity.
Compare diode mode readings on USB 3 data lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - USB port not working.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>USB3_EXTRA_R2D_P</SIGNAL> has contunity to <CAPACITOR>C4621</CAPACITOR>
<SIGNAL>USB3_EXTRA_R2D_N</SIGNAL> has contunity to <CAPACITOR>C4620</CAPACITOR>

<SIGNAL>USB3_EXTRA_R2D_C_P</SIGNAL> has 0.341 on diode reading (same on a known working good board)
<SIGNAL>USB3_EXTRA_R2D_C_N</SIGNAL> has 0.341 on diode reading. (same on a known working good board)

<SIGNAL>USB3_EXRTA_D2R_P</SIGNAL> has 0.352 on diode reading (0.379 on a known working good board)
<SIGNAL>USB3_EXRTA_D2R_N</SIGNAL> has 0.349 on diode reading (0.378 on a known working good board)


L4600 and <CAPACITOR>C4620</CAPACITOR>/21 integrity look ok. i've even replaced them, just in case.


i've compared every lines with a known working good board. all measurements matched.


fuked pch?




solder joints look ok under the shield


[img]https://i.imgur.com/GKqZzyX.jpg[/img]

[img]https://i.imgur.com/ejWWbsP.jpg[/img]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - USB port not working.
threads.message:
Bypass <CHIP>U4650</CHIP> and try again.
Also check USB 2 data lines in diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - USB port not working.
threads.message:
no change, USB thumb drive doesn't light up. same as before.

5.1v is still present on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_LTUSB_A_F</SIGNAL> after inserting a USB drive.
my usb desk lamp will power up ok.


[IMG type="full"]https://i.imgur.com/BczVVMd.jpg[/IMG]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - USB port not working.
threads.message:
If L4600 OK, then bad PCH...

Just in case, check <CHIP>U4600</CHIP> pin 8 level.
